basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Undergraduate at UC Santa Barbara, College of Creative Studies. Computing and Physics.

work.name: Laser Interferometry Gravitational Wave Observatory
work.summary: Machine learning for Engineering Design Automation. Designed and implemented a graph neural network based surrogate model for simulating optical physics in the LIGO interferometer, leading to over 40x speedups in simulation times. Investigated the applicability of Kolmogorov-Arnold networks in comparison to MLPs for physics simulation.

work.name: UC Santa Barbara
work.summary: Currently studying applications of machine learning in cosmology. Previously worked at OPUSLab, building FPGA based probabilistic computers, a form of Ising machine, and applying them to combinatorial optimization. Prior to that, I also worked in the computer architectures lab, studying data movement for petabyte scale and exascale machine learning.

work.name: UC Santa Barbara
work.summary: Learning assistant in the Computer Science and Physics departments. Helped teach Intro to Scientific Computing, Introductory Electrostatics, and Data Structures and Algorithms I.

work.name: Astranis Space Technologies
work.summary: Interned for the flight software team at Astranis, where I built tools to analyze satellite telemetry production to assist with link budgeting. I also implemented a satellite-GNSS receiver interface for satellite localization during orbit raise.

work.name: TenaFe Inc.
work.summary: Developed a lightweight simulation package for modelling read/write operations with the TenaFe SSD controller. This included modelling hardware components like TLC, QLC, and MLC NAND Flash, error correction modules, buffers, etc.
